intro: Anthospermum foetidum, commonly known as the stinking ant plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to yellowish flowers and its distinctive, often unpleasant odor. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a rough texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
